page.title: 09St Giles Church, Great Orton
page.content: The stone font has a beautiful carved wood cover made many years ago by a local resident as were the 2 chairs near the Communion table. There is a carved arm chair for when the Bishop visits, a carved lecrern and pulpit. The organ, once hand pumped, now has an electric blower. It is thought the organ was installed about 1860. A bell, hand pulled, is dedicated to 21 church wardens in 1728. On the north wall hangs the records of patrons, rectors and wardens. In 1626 the patron was Charles I, the rector Richard Burton. The Rectors' list dates from 1303. Pewter and silver Communion plates and chalices are kept in the church safe. One old grave stone dated 1811 tells of "Happy Dick" who taught at the school for 49 years and was Parish Clerk for 35 years. the churchyard was enlarged some years ago
